name: Avoid uncontrolled sleep calls (Python)
description: This rule reports calls to sleep functions that are vulnerable to DoS attacks.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
The software receives a user input, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the input before it is used in the waiting duration value passed to a sleep function such as "time.sleep()".
This may enable an attacker to perform a denial-of-service attack (DoS) by injecting a too-large sleep time value.
remediation:
Assume all input is malicious. 
Avoid using inputs. If it is not possible, use an "accept known good" input validation strategy, i.e., use stringent allow-lists that limit the value set based on the expected value of the parameter in the request. Another option is to define a range of acceptable waiting durations, specifying both a maximum and minimum value. This will indirectly limit the scope of an attack.
remediationSample:
import time

# solution 1
duration = get_waiting_duration() # tainted_source
waiting_time = {
    "short": 1,
    "medium": 3,
    "long": 10,
}
seconds = waiting_time[duration]  # range of acceptable durations
time.sleep(seconds)


# solution 2
max_waiting_time = 10
min_waiting_time = 1
seconds = get_waiting_duration() # tainted_source
seconds = min(seconds, max_waiting_time)  # establish upper limit
seconds = max(seconds, min_waiting_time)  # establish lower limit
time.sleep(seconds)
